byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Nicola Clark from Paris. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and NICOLA CLARK

abstract: United States Treasury Dept clears sale of dozens of planes by Boeing and Airbus to Iran, after sanctions are lifted according to terms of international nuclear agreement; country is eager to rebuild its decrepit fleet, which has been blamed for numerous fatal aviation accidents; some Congressional members opposed to move have pledged to thwart delivery.
lead_paragraph: The green light will allow Iran, a country desperately in need of hundreds of new aircraft, to begin replacing its aging fleet.
snippet: The green light will allow Iran, a country desperately in need of hundreds of new aircraft, to begin replacing its aging fleet....

headline.main: U.S. Allows Boeing and Airbus to Sell Planes to Iran
headline.print_headline: U.S. Gives Green Light for Aircraft Sales to Iran
